dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, this old thing? NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look like royalty. PENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs, delighted) Well, I try... Can't wait for your next book. Inchcombe's such a sauce- pot. Giles is always says `What are you reading Penny? You've got steam coming out of your ears...' She laughs like a drain. Nicholas joins in. Beth is strid away with the dog, infuriated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben has put a ring on Tamara's finger. TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's the ring saying, Ben? BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's saying hello I'm a ring. Will you marry me? Tamara looks at him, searchingly. BEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up? GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 50A.   TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know. BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't know what? GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 51.   TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That you were in love with me. BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ring says I'm platinum with a long guarantee. So give me a reply. Tamara is grinning from ear to ear. TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the best fun in the world. I'd love to marry you. She throws her arms around his neck. TAMARA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I say it then? BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say what? TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you. Tamara holds him, profoundly affected. Something akin to flickers across Ben's eyes. The phone rings. BEN (ANSWERING IT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? She's being proposed to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben's Porsche skids to a halt, music blaring. Diggory is  looking on in irate astonishment. The hat is on.  BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh! There are writers here, trying to write. Beth is in the hen enclosure, a hen in her arms.  BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a Buff Orpington. She's  looking a bit peaky today. Not a  great layer but she's very  decorative.  Beth puts down the hen.  BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're fully organic - but I like to  think that our champion product is  the written word.  Nicholas approaches, his hand held out, heartily.  GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 52.   NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The famous Ben - Swipe, eh? Ben just about manages to shake it. BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swipe's over. Thought the whole world knew that. NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't on Newsnight, no. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben is engaged to Tamara. Isn't that lovely? He'd just popped the question when I rang. NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said yes? Nicholas can't hide his disbelief. Ben is insulted. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're delighted for you both. Boss leaps up, straining against a chain. BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why's he on a chain? BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was out of control. BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you like to be chained up? BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was chasing livestock. He could've got shot. BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shoot him; I'll fucking shoot them.  He takes Boss. Beth and Nicholas are left alone. NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think the word is gobshite. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope he makes her happy. It's hard for girls when their dads walk out. Gives them bad taste in men. NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that supposed to mean? GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 53.   BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just saying her father left when she was a girl and - NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is ten pence psychology! You don't know what you're talking about, do you?  He walks away. Beth is completely taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas, wearing a woolly hat and scarf, is writing.

dialogues.speaker: NICHOLAS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Patel's eyes were open, eloquent in death... He looks up. In the distance, he can just see Tamara talk to Andy in the garden at Winnards Farm. Nicholas opens his desk. He finds a pair of old binocular He focuses them on Tamara. She holds out her hand with th ring on it. Andy has his arms wrapped around himself, his shoulders hunched. He nods, affecting congratulations. Nicholas tries to close in on Tamara. But she turns and g indoors. Also the yellow Porsche arrives. Nicholas puts t binoculars down.

dialogues.speaker: NICHOLAS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He knelt down - forensics be damned - and closed her eyes, forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara is turning the ring around her finger. BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Mai Buff Orpingtons. Oh, the written word. That's what the country does to you; turns you into one. What's up? TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a shame it doesn't fit. Perhaps you should have taken one of mine with you when you went to buy it. BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah but I didn't know you then. TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... when did you buy it? GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben realises his mistake. Tamara laughs, shocked. TAMARA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was this for someone else? Ben shrugs, not wanting to admit. The truth dawns. TAMARA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gave it to Fran didn't you? BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So? It's yours now. She never wore it. She didn't want it. TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You asked her to marry you...? BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a gesture, OK, when she started seeing Steve. Backfired, anyway. Look, I love you now. Tamara doesn't believe him. She is devastated. BEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not the ring that matters. I mean fuck the ring. It's just a consumerist piece of zinc. What matters is I want to marry you. TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you? BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. With my whole heart. And all the other stuff. Like my brain and my entrails and my whatever, pancreas. It all wants to marry you. He hugs her, starts kissing her but Tamara hardly respond

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas is staring out at the darkness. Beth is organisi things around him. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wondered if you had a delivery date in mind. I told her Easterish. Mind that cocoa, it's hot. Across at Winnards, Tamara's bedroom light comes on. For moment, she gazes out. Nicholas gazes back. GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 55.   BETH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a few invites; I'll pop them there. Just tick the ones you want to go to. Ben wraps his arms lovingly around Tamara. She draws the curtains as he pulls her away. BETH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Tim wants to know if you'll do your Christmas signing in Hadditon. I know he's always ungrateful but I think it's so important to keep these little bookshops open, don't you? NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh. Beth is on her way out. She turns and kisses him. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in soon, my love. Nicholas stares out into the darkness. He isn't working. isn't doing anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the field, Nicholas is an ageing, isolated figure in tiny pool of light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mud, frost and gloom add to the sense of neglect. Jody is smoking. Casey is eating Pringles. They share a magazine. CASEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at that cellulite... JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She been sitting on a bead car-seat or what? Casey turns a page. CASEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Her latest tattoo count was nine, including a Sumatran tiger and `Eternity' written in Sanskrit.' JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll be getting a barcode done next. Right across there. GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 55A.   CASEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice baby though. I'd like one that colour. GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jody chucks her fag-end into the bin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bin is on fire. Casey chucks in the Pringles box. The warm their hands, watching one of the boys wheelie his bi and fall off right into a freezing puddle. Casey giggles. CASEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That Ryan... JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a dick. CASEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he's cute. JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you don't. Would you snog him? CASEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be like having a slug in your mouth. Ben's yellow Porsche speeds right through the puddle, fur soaking Ryan. Ben and Tamara are both wearing designer sh despite the gloom; Boss in the back. Jody and Casey are both on their feet in a second. JODY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben! Ben! CASEY

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wankers. Ben gives them a grin and a wave. Jody's heart soars. JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jody is outside the back door. She lifts a flowerpot and takes the key from underneath. JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She keeps this here for Andy. GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 56A.   CASEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if she's got an alarm?  JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon find out.  Jody opens the door. They go in. The alarm is hanging off wall, the wires pulled out. Jody grins at Casey, satisfie GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 57.   CASEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if they come back? JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're too chicken, go home. The girls wander in, awed. Jody turns and grins, her eyes like a cat's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas is doing a book signing. There's a good crowd. NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that Claire with an `i'? Beth has a tray of mince pies. Glen is at her side. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you, Glen? Where will you be? GLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In London with a collection of spare academics. I guess we'll be decking the halls in our own erudite way. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll miss our chats.  GLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been in a state of writerly bliss these last weeks. I hope I get to come back. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too. We'd love to have you. Glen doesn't want Beth to move away. GLEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, this is the best mince pie I've ever had. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh? GLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it was possible to have an orgasm from mere food, this mince pie would do it. BETH (EMBARRASSED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Golly. She moves away. Glen heads for the wine, kicking himself. GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara and Ben walk in. Ben looks at the country casuals undisguised horror. BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are we doing here? TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's kind of research; I want to write about them. They're funny, Ben - come on. They move through the crowd. VINTNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The 2001 was the best. Someone just bought my last three cases... POSH HIPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I've got her this gorgeous Rajastani gagara skirt... Arriving at the mulled wine. TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides, I want to show you off. BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I - arm candy? TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More like arm fungus with that face on. Ben, meet Glen. Glen, meet Ben, my fiance. GLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're getting married? TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh. GLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Beautiful dress, magazine photoshoot - everything the aspiring novelist needs. TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew you'd be pleased. GLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a mince pie. BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we get out of here? TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 58A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She abandons him. Glen has turned away. Ben stands amid t nice chat, like a man being tortured. Meanwhile, Tamara is jumping the queue at Nicholas' desk. ARMY GEEK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Field of Tares, you made Fred a corporal. But there's no such thing in the Royal Artillery. They call them bombardiers. NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, thank you for that... TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. She flashes a smile at the Army Geek and puts her copy do in front of Nicholas. TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you do it for Ben? He's my fiance. We're getting married in the summer. GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 59.   NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I hear. You have my heartiest commiserations, Tara. He hands her the book dismissively. Tamara is smarting. TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well merry Christmas. Nicholarse. She turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jody sniffs Ben's aftershave, longingly. Casey plucks his guitar. They listen to the note in hushed awe.  Jody puts her foot into one of Tamara's killer stilettos. picks up Ben's drumsticks and kisses them, reverently.  JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta live the dream, Casey. Live the dream... Jody and Casey jump up and down on the unmade bed. Jody p a black T-shirt from under a pillow. She holds it to her face. JODY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben... Casey is looking out of the window. The yellow Porsche is heading up the lane. CASEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Omigod! A wild panic. They put things back where they found them. JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go! Go! Go! She nicks the T-shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls sprint down the stairs and out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They dive behind a bush as the car pulls in. They lie on ground splitting their sides with hushed laughter, as Ben Tamara disappear into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara and Ben are having a heated discussion. BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you sell it like you keep saying? TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because... I've started writing. BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can write anywhere. TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this is proper. Not just stuff for the paper. 'It's about my teens - and is working for me here. BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it might be memory lane for you but it's doing my fucking head in. I want London. I want some Urban, OK? Are you with me or what? Cos I've had it with this place. Tamara is hurt - and deeply disappointed. TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I'm with you... BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's drab. It's depressing. And every  time I look out of the window I see Andy's arse - what's that about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy is bending down, the top of his arse peeking out in morning sun. Ben stares at it with distaste. Andy is pluc a goose, putting all his frustration into it. BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're leaving. Thank God.  Andy looks at him.  GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 61.   BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara says you sell Christmas geese. ANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I have one? ANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now? BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Andy smirks, pointing at a big white duck. ANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That one's spare. BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a goose? ANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can take it now if you like. BEN (DISGUSTED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh come off it. ANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fucking alive. ANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you want it from Tesco, all plucked and headless sitting on a bandage. Ben's curiosity gets the better of him. BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How d'you do it then? Andy points towards an upturned traffic cone, held in pla by a metal frame. ANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gently put it's head down there; then quick in the skull with an air rifle.  Pluck it while it's warm, little pot  to catch all the blood - BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you enjoy doing that? GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 61A.   ANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but in my low wage economy, this flock's worth a lot. BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a sick fuck, Andy. Andy has had enough. GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 62.   ANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grow up. BEN (SQUARING UP)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say? Andy stands. He's at least two inches taller than Ben. ANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said grow up, little drummer boy. Ben thinks about it. He walks away. Glen appears with his suitcase on wheels containing most of his worldly goods. ANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara rang me this morning. Said  to finish the house. It goes on the  market in the spring and that's it; over. GLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why does the asshole always get the girl? He stands with Andy; comrades. Andy slaps him on the back ANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Or you'll miss that train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow falling outside. Jody and Casey are in school unifor Jody curled up on the bed; Casey at Tamara's PC. The room been redecorated.  JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't be just a shag, Case. It'll be an event. I'll be wearing like a gossamer slip with a bra bit; Prada. Or like a filmy, linen shirt, and... We see Jody's thought bubble. Ben is leaning against the frame, giving her a smouldering look.

dialogues.speaker: JODY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He'll be wearing a black T-shirt all taut over his buff bod and underneath Calvin Klein Boxers, black. Jody moves towards Ben. He buries his face in her neck as he's found the love of his life. GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 62A.

dialogues.speaker: JODY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And he'll have like one tattoo of my name and lush pecs and we'll have candles and white sheets and I'll smell of Allure by Chanel. GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben lifts Jody on to the bed. They marvel at each other. bends down to kiss her.

dialogues.speaker: JODY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And he tries to stop himself but I'm a vision and he gets drawn into my power and it'll be like Uhhh... But also respectful. And my `V' plates will melt into nothing. She looks up. Casey is reading at the PC. JODY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you listening? CASEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like this. JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? CASEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's this bit right, where her dad takes her for dinner and she thinks it's some big treat but what he's doing, right, is telling her he's leaving them. And she, right, she's gutted and she yaks all her food into a napkin and puts it on his plate. JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So? CASEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's painful. But funny. It's about her; Plastic Fantastic. She's sad, Jode. JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sad? She's a lucky cunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside the farm the snow falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara is trying to write. Ben is playing his drum kit, h as a kite. The noise is deafening. Tamara sits back, look around the boyish pad. It feels alien. The phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy is on the phone, examining the decrepit shed. Nothin has changed in a decade. GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 63A.   ANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what about the shed?

dialogues.speaker: TAMARA, (V.0)
dialogues.text: Hang on...  ANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I dismantling it - or mending it?  GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 64.

dialogues.speaker: FARM.
dialogues.text: Tamara takes the phone out onto the balcony to escape the noise. She slowly smiles, knowing what he's thinking.  TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know; the shed... What do you think? ANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I recommend preserving it. TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? ANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always useful, a good shed. TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then. Keep it... Andy puts the phone down, grinning. Tamara is grinning to sharing the same memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth is decorating a little pink valentine cake. She's on phone to Nicholas.  BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Oh dear...

dialogues.speaker: NICHOLAS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Yes, We thought it'd be a good  opportunity to catch up.  BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't you do it another day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas is standing by the window on his phone.

dialogues.speaker: NICHOLAS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Beth, you know what it's like.  Judy's off to New York tomorrow. We  can never find a window. Should be  home around ten.  He puts the phone down.  GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 64A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth looks at the cake. It says To My Valentine in piped  lettering around the edge. She picks up her icing bag, fu of unease.  In the middle of the cake she ices a big question mark. T she quickly looks up a number and dials.  BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Judy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy and Nicholas are eating their starters.  JUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth, hello love.  BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry, I think Nicholas has  got his phone turned off and um -  JUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right here. I'll put him on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh - actually - don't worry - I've  just found it.  Beth puts the phone down, biting her lip. She is relieved ashamed and ultimately not reassured. She looks to camera BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas has been telling the truth  a lot recently.  The cake, with its question mark, is finished.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Roses are red, violets are blue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jody, dressed in Tamara's leopard skin coat, is admiring herself in Tamara's mirror, swigging from a bottle of win We hear Casey reading the card.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You are so fit I wanna shag you. Love from Ben pfwoor!!! Jody takes another swig with a wicked grin, she sits at Tamara's PC. We hear Casey knock three times on the back door.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. DAY. WINNARDS FARM
dialogues.text: Outside Casey is waiting. Jody lets her in. She has accessorised the leopard print coat with red stilettos, a Chloe bag and bright red lipstick. CASEY (SHOCKED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just messing. I got one from Mum, one from that peanut Ryan, and a mystery one from Ben. CASEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sent you that. Jody takes another swig from the bottle of wine. CASEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that theirs? JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my mum's; they don't drink this shit. She hands it to Casey. JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look what I'm doing. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jody plonks herself down at Tamara's PC. JODY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to get him back down here. I'm sending him a valentine. GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 66.   CASEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you are not! JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From her address. CASEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll think it's from Tamara, you dipshit. JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I know it'll be from me. Subject: Hot Love. CASEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused, despite herself) Oh God, Jody... JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Contacts: where are you Ben? CASEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, there's that bloke my mum works for; Nicholas Hardiment. JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's put him on. Who else? CASEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Andy.  JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy Cobb.  (typing as she speaks) `Come to Winnards Farm. I'll give you  the biggest shagging of your life. Love Tamara xxx.' They fall about giggling. Jody swigs more wine. CASEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ever, ever send that. JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just did. Casey is appalled. CASEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never! Jody nods. CASEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll spoil it! Jody - I love coming here and you'll spoil it! GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 66A.   JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I won't. GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 67.   CASEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll know someone's read all her stuff! JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll delete it from sent items. It's just a laugh, Case. I only want Ben to come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben is reading the email looking angry and jealous. BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth opens the email. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Come to Winnards Farm.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy is on the public computer looking completely puzzled ANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `I'll give you the biggest shagging of your life...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth starts, utterly shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe is leaning over Andy's shoulder, reading the email. ZOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She must want a foursome. Or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben is bashing away at his drums. Boss is barking. Tamara trying to remonstrate with Ben over the din. TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many times? I didn't send it! Are you listening to me? BEN! WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops. He looks at her, betrayed. TAMARA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you believe me? I didn't write that email. BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Explain it then. TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this about Fran? BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's Fran got to do with it? TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's the reason you don't trust me. Just because she fucked around on you it doesn't mean that I will. Ben, furious, starts drumming again. Tamara boiling with frustration, walks away.  105 CUT 105

dialogues.speaker: FIELD, (LIMBURY)
dialogues.text: Tamara is on the phone at the far end of the flat. TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't pissed, or depraved or ANYTHING -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy is outside his shed. ANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's OK, it's OK... The drumming leads up to a massive crescendo and stops. TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you go to the farm? Just take a look, see if anyone's been in. ANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem. TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Ben's really pissed off. He's massively got the hump - Ben appears from the other end of the large room. BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have I? GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 68A.   TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got to go. Sorry. She puts the phone down. GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 69.   TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've just asked him to go and check over the farm - BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you thick? TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it obvious who sent it? That tosser Andy Cobb. TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wouldn't do that. BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Making himself all cosy in your house. Going through your stuff, prob'ly wearing your fucking pants - TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way! BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bet it was him that nicked my black T-shirt. TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no way Andy would do that! Ben pulls his jacket on. BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that says it all; the way you leap to his defence. TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hasn't done anything. BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what? I know Fran fucked my best friend but at least she was straight with me. TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben - where are you going? Don't go! BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck's sake. GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes her away, harder than he meant to. She lands on sofa, shocked. BEN (CONT'D) (WITHOUT APOLOGY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm taking the dog for a crap. He grabs the lead and opens the door. It slams shut. Tama dread overwhelms her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poppy is reading a print-out of Tamara's email. Beth is folding sheets. POPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh come on mum. She's just stirring shit. Tamara's always done that. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why's your father on there - and poor Andy? It's so tasteless. POPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (helping with the sheets) You know how subversive she is. She once sent me a valentine from Prince Harry - and I believed it. It's her sense of humour; she likes causing trouble. At school she used to give us first years tips on how to shoplift. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She taught you to shoplift? POPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mum, she's marrying Ben Sergeant. Why would she look at an old git like dad? Nicholas is in the shadowy hall, listening with interest. Poppy helps Beth upstairs with the laundry. Nicholas step into the kitchen. Poppy has left the email on the table. Nicholas picks it up, deeply curious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas is walking up the field wearing his red scarf. A is outside his shed, doing heavy work. NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you make of that email from Tamara? GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 70A.   ANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It don't make any sense. Her London  boyfriend's trying to fuck her up;  that's my theory.  Andy carries on working.  ANDY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She could do so much better.  Nicholas walks on.  NICHOLAS  (TO HIMSELF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't agree more.  GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Casey and Jody are pouring over a gossip mag; pictures of celebrity blonde with new man. CASEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come she's with a different bloke every week and when Lesley Hunt's  sister shagged Jeff Dobson - just once, after he lied he loved her - she gets called a dirty slag. JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Pointing at the blonde) That's cos she does it in five star resorts around the world - and not The Feathers carpark. Over the page, Ben canoodling in a freezing park with Fra JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Ben! CASEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Who's the daddy? Steve Culley and Fran Redmond recently announced they were expecting. But in a Valentine tryst shocker Fran is snapped with ex Ben Sergeant! Ben and Fran - we say Get A Room.' JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's back with Fran? After... CASEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After that email, Jode. JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way. No way! Tamara's car zooms past. Her expression is black. JODY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Omigod... what if she's dumped? GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara arrives outside her house. Depressed. She remains the car, reluctant to go in, to face her isolation.  She looks at herself in the mirror. The face that stares seems like that of a stranger.   109 DELETED 109

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara is lying in bed with her brand new nose bandaged u He face is covered in bruising. She is panicking -  experiencing a loss of self.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mask drops. All her old insecurities come back. She g out of the car and slams the door, unable to stand the si of herself. She lets herself in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The inside of the house has been transformed by Andy. The drab gloomy shades of her mother have gone, replaced by w tones which bring out the beauty of the house.  Tamara wanders through. She turns around taking it all in She never knew the house was so beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jody is weeping into her mobile phone. JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll never see Ben again... And it's all MY FAULT. Jody's mum comes into the room. MUM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's all your fault? JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (putting the phone down) None of your business. MUM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm bloody sick of you looking like a wet weekend. Who's Ben? GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 72A.   JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one. MUM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What've you done? JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. MUM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you in trouble? JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO!... Leave me alone. MUM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take care with boys, Jody. You know what can happen. JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can happen? What can ever, ever happen in a place like this? She throws herself on her duvet, inconsolable. GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth is with Lucetta, another writer, crossing a field. Lucetta raises her binoculars passes them to Beth. POV SHOT AT MARVELL'S FARM. LUCETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are they crows or jackdaws? It's so nice to get these little details right. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're rooks. LUCETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got an unhappy wife and a newly qualified vet discovering a forbidden world of physical love in a bird hide. BETH (THROUGH BINOCULARS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's Nicholas... Nicholas's red scarf makes him visible from afar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas sees Tamara. He waits while she emerges from the copse. TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for Andy. NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not up at Stonefield. Tamara is about to turn back.  NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what about this shag I've been  reading about?  TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh fuck off. NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I liked your email. Very succint.  TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I didn't send it. And I wouldn't shag you if you were the last man left after a nuclear winter. GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 73A.   NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll come round tomorrow then. About three? GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 74.   TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop dead you smug prick. Nicholas watches her storm back up the copse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara's car pulls up. Jody and Casey wheel around closer their bikes. Tamara tries the door. The pub is shut. She looks in through the glass and sees Zoe up on the bar, clinging to Andy in a long embrace. Tamara is frozen. And kisses Zoe, long and tender. Tamara turns. She gets back in her car, trying to hide her distress - w has taken her completely by surprise. Jody and Casey star mutely as she drives away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy and Zoe finish their kiss. ZOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still time to change your mind. Blue skies. Fun in the sun. ANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just not a traveller, Zoe. ZOE (GENTLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know... you're like a big old tree. Stuck here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas parks his 4X4. As he gets out, he is on the phon NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll probably stay on at the library for another hour or two. Yes... just checking some law reports.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara is playing with the ill-fitting ring that Ben gave her. She puts it a jar and closes the lid. There's a knoc the front door. She startles, her face falling. She answe it. Nicholas is on the threshold.  GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 75.   NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. Nicholas. She lets the door fall open. She backs into the hall. Nicholas walks in. He closes the door. They look at each other. Neither of them moves. NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can tell me to leave. Tamara says nothing.  NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can throw me right out. Nicholas slowly takes his red scarf and coat off. He hang them on a coat hook, bringing himself closer to her. NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just say and I'll go. She still can't speak. Nicholas takes her in his arms. He big and fatherly and comforting. Tamara feels a sense of relief, of not being alone. Her a go around him. When he kisses her, he's surprisingly real vulnerable even, as if he's left his lordly persona at th door. Tamara closes her eyes. Their kisses become more urgent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara is lying in Nicholas' arms in the growing darkness looks blissfully post-coital. Tamara is gazing ahead. A t rolls down her cheek. It lands on Nicholas' chest. NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you crying? TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Nicholas is taken aback. He instinctively holds her. NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't cry. Am I really that bad? Tamara shakes her head, glad of him. TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just not myself.  GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 76.   NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you are. She looks up at him. NICHOLAS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're relentlessly, rudely, uncompromisingly yourself. A smile appears on Tamara's face.  TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to watch you out of my window helping your daughter learn to skateboard up the lane. Bit of an obvious crush, wasn't it. NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that why you're crying? TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I here as revenge on your ex? TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know why you're here. Why are you here, Nicholas? NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because... since you climbed over that stile in the summer I haven't  thought about very much else. She doesn't believe him. TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can use me in one of your books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas is putting his coat on. Tamara is uneasy. NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When can we do this again? TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Beth? NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Beth and I have this kind of OPEN - TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit. GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 76A.   NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thursday? GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 77.   TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't life complicated enough? Nicholas shakes his head. He kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas strolls in. He's ecstatically happy. Beth is get something out of the Aga. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh poor you - was it awful? NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloody terrible. Didn't move till well past Chiswick. But look, I nipped into Fortnums... He hands her a package. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All my favourite teas - Oh! He embraces her. He is affectionate, magnanimous in his bliss. Beth is taken aback by his warmth. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My goodness. You feel like my buzzy toothbrush just after I've charged it up. You should go up to London more often. NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I will... Nicholas goes to the table. The writers greet him as he s NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry everybody; traffic was a pig. Do carry on... LUCETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying this magic realist bit at the end of chapter three, where the characters slowly turn into BIRDS - NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sounds very innovative... LUCETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think so? It's sort of the key to the structure, which I'm thinking of as a nest shape... GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas listens benevolently as Lucetta shares. His good humour is so out of his recent character that Beth watche him with increasing unease. There is something in her eye akin to suspicion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth is putting Glen's luggage into the boot. GLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So after two years of radio silence I contact my editor. And she loves - I mean loves the chapters I did in the fall. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Glen. GLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried writing at the library but  I could feel that awful paralysis  descending again.

dialogues.speaker: GLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I missed everything that I've been,  you know, finding here.  (Seeing the view)  Oh my god - it's so beautiful!  They are now in the village driving down the main drag.  BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you've come back. GLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few solid weeks should - holy cow! An egg hits the windscreen (shot the same way as the earl scene). Casey and Jody hide. Beth gets out of the car to clean the window. GLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Idiots! Morons! Hey, writers! Let's egg the self-regarding sacks of shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glen is helping Beth prepare the evening meal. They are b animated, enjoying one another's company. GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 79.   GLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's this theory he gave his wife syphilis, right? No evidence but the symptoms fit. The poor woman gets kind of eccentric and moves her bed up to their attic - BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bastard - GLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, Hardy falls in love with a woman who is thirty nine years younger than him. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe it. Nicholas is passing through, reading The Independent. NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geoff. GLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glen. NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry James. GLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas Hardy. NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, a Hardy book. Coming well? GLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, actually. Nicholas returns to the paper. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gave his wife syphilis. NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolly good. He goes. Beth is ashamed of his condescension. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's completely distracted. He's up  and down to London all the time. The latest Inchcombe's taking  everything he's got.  GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas is reading, hunched over a computer. He glances  round. Tamara, wearing a robe, is awaiting his opinion.  TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it any good? Because I keep -  NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shush.  (Points at the screen)  This is brutally candid. You lay  yourself completely bare.  TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm well-known for it.  NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously. It's very moving.  Tamara knows this is praise indeed. She is deeply gratifi TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... have I done my duty? TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admirably. NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now do I get my treat? Tamara, almost in his arms, is crestfallen. TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are so cheesy. Tamara is staring at him with something akin to distaste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jody and Casey share a magazine and a spliff in the bus s JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zero Ben sightings in two whole months. CASEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last time I saw Plastic she looked like a minger; all red-eyed and gutted. Ben's a Love Rat. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 81.
dialogues.text: CASEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She should move on... JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's probably topped herself. I would if Ben dumped me. CASEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jode. Don't say that. What if she's done something? JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like got in the bath with her heated tongs? CASEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like taken a stack of pills? We see Jody's thought bubble of Tamara luridly dead, her mouth coated with dried froth and vomit. JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D'you think she might be lying there all choked in vomit and drug froth? CASEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'd be dire. JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we find her we'll get in the papers. CASEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rock Chick Dead at Winnards Farm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy is outside the farm beside his landrover. He walks u the front door. Hesitates.  Behind the railings, the girls arrive.  CASEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's Uncle Andy doing here?  Andy knocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hearing the knock, Tamara springs out of bed. Nicholas sp into a panic.  NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arse biscuits.  GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 81A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Casey and Jody are watching as Andy waits.  CASEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer...  JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She could have been lying there  days. She could be like putrid now,  like rancid -  CASEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, I'm gonna chuck -  JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like bloated and all greeny.  CASEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Uncle Andy'll find her by the  smell!  BOTH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eurrrrr! Shhhhh!!    (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 82.
dialogues.text: BOTH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: I/E. DAY. WINNARDS FARM
dialogues.text: Tamara opens the door in some deshabille. To her surprise she sees Andy on the threshold, looking spruced up and  handsome. The contrast with Nicholas couldn't be more  apparent. She finds herself genuinely pleased to see him. TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy...  Behind the railings, the girls can't help their look of  disappointment at seeing her alive.  JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bollocks. ANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't seen you for a while. Thought you might be ill or something. Or depressed or - TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had my head down, writing.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 83.
dialogues.text: ANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come for a drink. Let's lighten up.  TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love to, but...  ANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shake off the winter blues. Come  celebrate the spring.  TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't... I'm kind of on one with  my writing. Over her shoulder, Andy sees Nicholas' red scarf and coat hanging on the coat hook. He hides his shock. Tamara is  unaware that he has seen.  TAMARA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we do it soon though? I'd  really like to; just not right now.  He nods at her in disbelief.  ANDY  (COOLLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  He turns on his heels and goes. Tamara closes the door.  Outside, Andy is leaning over his land-rover, sickened.  JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D'you think he's in with a chance?  CASEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way.  JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Beth is taking Nicholas' awards down and chucking them in box. Glen is trying to save them from smashing. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet that bitch wants a baby. Well she'll find out; Nicholas doesn't do children. GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 99A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is brandishing a diamond dagger award. BETH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll leave it all up to her. That'll age her. GLEN BETH - BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But suppose he discovers fatherhood? (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 100.
dialogues.text: BETH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They do, these men, second time round. They get all nappy-happy. I was barely twenty when I got pregnant. I've never done anything! Oh God! God! GLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you have. Look at this place! BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate him - I've wasted my life!  GLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... What about all the work you do here? BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breeding goats? Baking fucking biscuits? It's meaningless! Beth bawls. Glen holds her. GLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth... When I was lost with my book you helped me more than you know. You asked who I was writing it for... He starts to really hold her. The sobbing subsides. GLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You. He kisses her. Beth looks at Glen; a revelation. The futu opens up. She kisses him back. NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Nicholas is standing in the doorway, looking grey. NICHOLAS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I speak with my wife? Glen releases Beth. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You may not. She walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth walks outside towards the chicken coup. Nicholas pur her. She sees Boss running across the grounds chasing bir NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Ben Sergeant's dog. Perhaps  he's come to beat the shit out of  you - good!  NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth - I finished it. She's been  chasing me; this wild crush -  BETH  LIAR -  NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something desperate about  her, something almost unhinged -  BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good God, even when you try and  tell the truth you lie. YOU LIE!! Nicholas is falling apart. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to leave. I want a divorce. I want Stonefield. NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth...Don't. You can't. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will. (TO BOSS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you - Go home! Bugger Off!! She throws a handful of chicken feed at him. Boss runs aw Beth storms off. Nicholas looks profoundly shocked; like a man who has jus realised he's in danger of drowning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara's car pulls up outside. She gets out, looking at t yellow Porsche in complete disbelief.  TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben...  GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 101A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jody is shakily pouring a pot of tea. BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Now put two sugars in and stir it. OK. That's a decent cup. Which is lucky Jody cos if it had been shit, I'd be on the phone to the extremely scary local cops right now. JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't tell my mum. BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it was boring round here but for fuck's sake... JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna get out as soon as I can. Going to work in Vegas - as a croupier. Vegas, or a cruise liner. BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aim high, that's what I say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara lets herself in. She calls:  TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben?

dialogues.speaker: GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 102.
dialogues.text: BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara. You've had an infestation. TAMARA (ENTERING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of what? BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jody. Jody, shamefaced, prepares to cough up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss is lolloping round. He stops. The whole herd of cows staring at him. Boss regards the animals with curiosity. wags his tail. Will they play? He starts to bark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas sees Glen sitting on the edge of an old rusting trough. Fury overwhelms him.  NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oy! Greg! I want a a word with you. GLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Glen, asshole. Nicholas is stomping through the mud and cowshit.  NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucking devious bastard. GLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm devious? I'm a bastard?  NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I haven't noticed how you've been worming your way in?  You keep your hands off my wife,  you low-rent pedant.  GLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've abused her long enough /  with your goddamn lies -  NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you out of my house.  GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 103.   GLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Beth's. She made this place -  NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I fucking pay for it. I've  given Beth all this. What can you  give her?  GLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can give her / integrity!  NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obscure literary shit not worth ten  PENCE -  GLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know if I made my pile fantasizing rapes and homicides I wouldn't be so proud. NICHOLAS (SHOVING HIM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You cunt. GLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you. Glen grabs him round the middle. They struggle like overg schoolboys. NICHOLAS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth'll come to her senses. You need an income to run Stonefield. And mine's bigger than yours! Glen nuts him. Nicholas slips backwards in the mud. He wh his skull on the sharp, rusting corner of the trough. He falls to the ground. Glen is astonished at his own prowes GLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now... get up, Nicholas. Let's talk about this like grown men. Blood trickles from the wound on Nicholas' head. He moans GLEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. Nicholas... Glen becomes aware of a sound like a drumbeat, the drummi of hooves. The herd of cows come over the brow of the hil and down towards them. Boss is chasing them, barking. The beasts are terrified, stampeding. GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are heading straight for the trough. Nicholas is try to get up on his knees. GLEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas! Get up! Run! Glen puts out a hand to help him. But before Nicholas notices, he instinctively retrieves it. Glen turns on his heels and runs, terrified. He throws himself into the hedge as the cows thunder past. They disappear down the hill, Boss still behind them. Glen looks back towards the water trough. Nicholas is lyi on his front, his face pressed into the mud, unmoving. Glen walks over. He gingerly peers at him. The back of Nicholas' skull is broken open. Blood is pooling in the m and shit. Glen panics. He looks all around. Has the accid been seen? No human is visible. Has his part in it been noticed? He bends down as if to turn the body over, in case by some miracle Nicholas still lives. He cannot bring himself to touch him. Fear overwhelms him. He runs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara is looking at Jody, stunned. TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was you? Jody can't look her in the eye. BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jody has explained that she did it out of deep love for me. To Ben's astonishment, Tamara smiles. He grabs his moment BEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara...  It's an apology. Tamara takes Ben's hand and leads him  through to a dresser in the hall. She opens it. TAMARA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben.  She takes the ring out of the jar and puts it in his hand TAMARA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in love with someone else. At that moment, Casey appears at the back door. GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 105.   CASEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jody - the dog!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss is still worrying the herd. He's got them against a gate. The animals are very distressed. Behind them we see Andy's Landrover appear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy gets out of his Landrover, takes out his rifle, come through the gate. Loads his rifle while watching the dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His POV. The dog and the cattle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through his sights, the dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As his finger tightens on the trigger. Bang. A shot rings out. He looks round, off right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up on the ridge of the hill, Penny Upminster is standing straw hat and flowery wellies, with a smoking gun. PENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got `im. The beast.  166 CUT 166

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth, chucking fan mail into the bin, stops in her tracks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara's head appears at the front door.  GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 106.    168 CUT 168

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth is coming down the field where Nicholas lies. She se figure in the distance. She squints, the sun in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opposite her she sees Tamara descending through the copse

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara, walking down by the trough, discovers Nicholas' b She drops to her knees, light-headed with shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth walks into the field. She sees Tamara kneeling, look at something on the other side of the trough. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitch. Tamara looks up. TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth - no - BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brazen. That is brazen. Beth carries on walking towards her. TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth. Don't. Tamara is running towards Beth. She cannot bear her to se She throws her arms around her, protecting her. TAMARA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look. Don't look... It is too late. Beth is seeing the corpse. A great wave o shock hits her. Tamara holds her tight, trying to contain Another great wave of shock. GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 107.   BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas. No. Her cries of grief soar over the valley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara, ashen, is on the phone to emergency services.  TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll get to it through Byley farm.  His skull is broken. It's smashed. No  I haven't but... it's obvious. His  wife. Yes she is. Thank you. Thank  you. I will.  Beth has turned Nicholas over. She is washing the mud fro his face with water from the trough. TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're on their way...  Beth seems totally closed off. Tamara gingerly approaches She touches Beth's shoulder. TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth? Help is coming -  Beth cannot bear to be touched. Her hand involuntarily fl out. It slams into Tamara's face. Tamara steps back. Her nose is broken, pouring blood. TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's broken! -  She gasps, riding the pain, knowing she deserves it. It's biggest wake-up call of her life. Beth stares at her, at first astonished at what she has d then satisfied. Tamara stumbles away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara sits beside a dewpond, gingerly washing the blood her face. ANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara... Andy is watching. She turns away from him. He approaches. TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  She starts crying bitter tears.  GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 107A.   ANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tam, come on. It was an accident. Still Tamara cries. He comforts her. She lets him. He hol her for some time.  ANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd better get up to Stonefield. Come with me. We'll get this sorted. GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 108.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara shakes her head. She separates herself from him an stands. ANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then get Ben to take you to London.  Make sure he looks after you. Tamara walks a few paces away. She stares straight ahead. TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to be with Ben.  She looks back at Andy. He begins to understand. She walk off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glen, sick with dread, is drying his face with a towel. H picks up his muddy shoes and clothes, wraps them in a bag shoves them in his case.  His eyes alight on his poster of Thomas Hardy. He pulls i down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and the girls have dug a grave for Boss. Casey is put flowers on the top. Ben starts to cry like a broken-heart little boy. Jody instinctively puts her arms round him. T girls are immensely moved. Jody looks over at Casey. She MOUTHS: JODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pap me! Pap me! Casey waits until Ben is not looking. Then she takes pict with her mobile phone. Jody cradles Ben in her arms, doin her best moved-but-sultry pose. Casey tries not to laugh. Jody is ecstatic. The man of her dreams is in her arms. H wish has come true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ambulance and two police cars are in the courtyard. Th police are carrying the corpse, covered in blankets. Andy crosses the yard to the barn. He bumps into Glen furtivel coming out of the door. Glen's case is packed. ANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Glen can't look him in the eye. GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 108A.   GLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figured I'd best, you know, take myself off. She doesn't want writers around the place now. And police, autopsies, not my thing - GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 109.   ANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't run away. GLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not running away! I just finished my book; my time here is up. Destiny calls. ANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth is asking for you. GLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's... Really? ANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's on her own over there. Glen, she doesn't need a writer around the place. She needs a man. 173 DELETED 173 174 DELETED 174

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth is sitting, still pale with shock, her hands around mug of tea. Glen approaches. GLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry. Beth looks up at him despairingly. GLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do they... suspect anyone? I mean of like Foul Play? BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was my fault. I let the dog go! GLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no... BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shooed him away! The police said it was an accident but... GLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't your fault!  BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I don't understand is why was he in that field anyway? He hated cows. And when they were coming, why didn't he get out of their way? GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 109A.   GLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth. I have to tell you... GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 110-111.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a moment, confession and silence hang in the balance. Glen opens his mouth to speak. GLEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You live in the country. You share it with those dangerous beasts. And when they're scared, they run. Like we do... Glen is full of horror at his lie. But Beth is only grateful. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glen. Stay with me. Her eyes, still red with grief, are full of their future together. Glen nods. He will stay. He wants it all. Beth leans into him, seeking comfort. He puts his arms ar her, his face ashen with the weight of his secret. As he holds her, he looks around the room. Nicholas is everywhere, glaring down at him from photographs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara is in the garden, a strip on her nose. She sees An in the dusk. He's leaning against the gate watching her. TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say anything. ANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kind of suits you. And I always did like the old one. They are in each others arms. The embrace lasts and lasts Tamara is leading Andy up to the house. TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did it on purpose, didn't you? ANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Made it so beautiful I'd never be able to leave. ANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been dying to get rid of you. This is my house. I was born in that room. GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 112.   TAMARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you were. They are at the threshold. They kiss. TAMARA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome home.
